intro: Polyscias vieillardii subsp. balansae, commonly known as the Balansae Polyscias, is a member of the Araliaceae family. It is a shrub or small tree native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia, including parts of Indonesia and the Philippines. The plant features compound leaves with opposite arrangement and produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in umbels. Its fruit is a berry that turns red when mature, containing several seeds. It is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and adaptability to various soil types.
